answers.answer: HiWelcome to the MedHelp forum!Tingling in head region (mouth, lips, tongue etc) is seen in peripheral neuropathies as in diabetes. It is also seen in peripheral vascular disease.Compression of cervical spinal nerves too can cause it. It can also be due to cold and sinusitis. In all probability it is cervical nerve compression as you feel it here and there too. It can also be a condition like fibromyalgia. Electrolyte imbalance is also a possibility. Without examining you it is difficult to access the situation. Please do not ignore it. Get a neurological consultation ASAP.Hope this helps. Please let me know if there is any thing else and do keep me posted. Take care!

question: I have been having tingling eyelids, mouth area, hands and legs for the past couple of days now it's really starting to bug me and im just wondering if anyone else has these kind of symptoms. Should I be worried ?? I feel it everywhere sometimes and they last for about 30 minutes to an hour or sometimes even all day. I don't know what to think. Someone please help me.
title: Tingling eyelids, mouth area, hands and legs.
